Citation Tracker Pro
- Single-file Python 3 script using ONLY standard library (json, os, pathlib, datetime, csv, argparse, shutil, webbrowser)
- CLI research utility for managing academic citations with persistent JSON storage in user home directory (~/.citations.json)
- Core features:
  * Add citation: python script.py add --title "Paper Title" --authors "Author1, Author2" --year 2023 --url "https://doi.org/..."
  * List all citations sorted by year/authors with search/filter: python script.py list [--search "keyword"] [--year 2023]
  * Export to CSV: python script.py export citations.csv (includes columns: title,authors,year,url,notes,tags,added_date)
  * Import from JSON: python script.py import backup.json (merges without duplicates based on title+year hash)
  * Open URL in default browser: python script.py open 1 (opens first citation's URL)
- Data model: Each citation is dict with keys: id (auto-generated UUID-like hash), title, authors (comma-separated), year, url, notes, tags (comma-separated), added_date (ISO format)
- Persistence: Auto-save/load JSON file with atomic writes (temp file + rename). Create if missing.
- Drag-and-drop simulation: Support file drop via stdin pipe (read JSON/CSV from file redirect)
- Dark/Light theme: Auto-detect via os.environ['TERM'] or simple colorama-style ANSI codes (use termcolor logic with stdlib: print("\033[94mBlue\033[0m"))
- Keyboard shortcuts in interactive mode: python script.py interactive (q=quit, a=add, l=list, s=search)
- Validation: URLs with urllib.parse.urlparse(), years 1900-2030, required fields enforced
- Testable: Pre-populate 3 sample citations on first run. Add --test flag prints sample data without saving.
- Error handling: Pretty formatted errors, --help for all commands, backup before destructive ops
- Keep under 800 LOC: Use pathlib for paths, json for data, csv for export, hashlib for IDs, argparse for CLI
